At the #chester market today & decided to try the bike wheel guide on the steps as others felt it is too close to the wall/handrail

RT @Go_CheshireWest: If you're visiting Chester's new market this week, why not give the Park & Ride a try? üëâ https://t.co/ae5Qw2eRh4 https‚Ä¶
@the_joe_smoe Hermitage rd (autocorrect having fun!)

@the_joe_smoe Coming from the Everton arms pub towards the village, as you pass green lane on the right, there is an old black/white house on the right corner of the junction where the road veers left then right. This house used to be a sweet shop.
@the_joe_smoe The village was known in two parts, this all being 'great saughall' with the area up towards green lane and the egerton pub known as 'little saughall'
@the_joe_smoe The message written under the swinging gate pub sign read ‚Äúthis gate hangs well, it hinders none, refresh and pay, then travel on.‚Äù

@the_joe_smoe Heritage road, looking down towards the seahill/ church road junction. The small chapel is set back on the left, as the road kinks to the right. Now a private house but there is still a graveyard to the rear of it that can be visited. https://t.co/JnAvcCsmeh
@the_joe_smoe And "whaleys" shop next to the swinging gate pub. It had a telephone that the villagers could use to make phone calls https://t.co/CyALYIxC4b

@the_joe_smoe A couple of 'Smithy Garage' when it was actually the local smithy. Pictures of the original smithy before the replacement was built on the same spot and in the guise we know it today. Also notice Chapel (now house) next door, still with window in gable end https://t.co/b8RjyA6zl1
@the_joe_smoe A few more of Saughall. Another of the swinging gate pub and one of the Vernon institute opposite, but before the tower was added https://t.co/xk2NNQhbRe

Broadband is laughable too as Openreach won't replace a rotten pole, but that is the least of our problems!

@SnapperCharlie @robherdch3 @ShitChester @ThatBeerPlaceHQ @JohnWumz @CwacGreen Agree. I've moaned about this before. We have a new cycle hub in the City centre & not a single joined up safe cycling route between it & the city's housing areas. Even worse, what did exist has been suspended!

@AidanBaker7 @robherdch3 @ThatBeerPlaceHQ @JohnWumz @ShitChester @CwacGreen Agreed. Plenty of train 'pausing/waiting' areas aee used near the main stn. Some could be utilised. Also reintroduction of P&R facilities with plentiful (& highly visible signage, also posted on the major A rds leading towards the city ) would be help too.
@Annabuttercup Unreal üòÆ
@JohnWumz @TourGuideLiverp @robherdch3 @ThatBeerPlaceHQ @ShitChester @CwacGreen Why have we not formed our own 'Chester residents independent party' ? üòÇ

@TourGuideLiverp @JohnWumz @robherdch3 @ThatBeerPlaceHQ @ShitChester @CwacGreen Were they ever completely removed & then reinstated many years later after significant changes in building development etc?
Don't get me wrong, I would be screaming to have existing services retained, but reintroduction after more than 90yrs is a totally different ball game.

@JohnWumz @TourGuideLiverp @robherdch3 @ThatBeerPlaceHQ @ShitChester @CwacGreen Braver when riding my tall bike (2 bikes stacked) but at least it's easier to see what the traffic is doing ahead üòÇ https://t.co/YfCMbrgx62

@JohnWumz @Rach_A_Rama @ShitChester @CwacGreen Whatever happened to the "hop a stop" deal where it was a nominal payment to jump on the bus to get off 2 stops later? I always used to walk to the bus stop further up the rd from my house when going to the pub as it saved loads on the fare üòÅ
@Rach_A_Rama @ShitChester @JohnWumz @CwacGreen Exactly. It is criminal that this is the case. I also believe the bus services / tender processes need a good shake up too üëç
@JohnWumz @TourGuideLiverp @robherdch3 @ThatBeerPlaceHQ @ShitChester @CwacGreen Err....  I ride one of those üòÇüòÇ

@robherdch3 @ThatBeerPlaceHQ @JohnWumz @ShitChester @CwacGreen They are best left in the past as a romantic reminiscence, unless the modern equivalent can be installed as part of a regeneration scheme that includes rd infrastructure.

@JohnWumz @ThatBeerPlaceHQ @ShitChester @CwacGreen Exactly my point. Retrofit is only really good for this sort of installation in our city. But why would you go to that expense!
Cheaper to extend the Grosvenor park train üòÅ
@ShitChester I was in the centre on both Wednesday & Thursday. Xmas market not open yet, but still really busy.

@Welovepandas @angeblack200 @ShitChester I got the feeling that a certain candidate had been trying really hard to revise facts about the city, like preparing for an exam. If you truly know the city, then your words should flow easily about the subject

@ThatBeerPlaceHQ @JohnWumz @ShitChester @CwacGreen Totally agree. I also believe they are a great idea when installed as part of regeneration of areas, or during new build.
I don't believe they are the right infrastructure as a retrofit into a rd for longer distances than one straight rd journey

@jde7582 @JohnWumz @ShitChester @CwacGreen Don't get me started on the pain local businesses go through to recycle cardboard etc... üôà

@jde7582 @JohnWumz @ShitChester @CwacGreen I could go on.....   and on.... and on...

@jde7582 @JohnWumz @ShitChester @CwacGreen Agreed.
A 2 tier parking rate system: i.e. cheap, safe, regular P&R facilities. If you want to park in the city, my god you pay for it unless disabled badge etc.
Electric bus services between attractions AND hospital.
Bicycle hire between station & city with designated safe route

@Martin_Dagnall @ShitChester @JohnWumz @CwacGreen Chester had them too.
We are a modern age now (allegedly) so why have electric trams that can only go where tracks go, when you can get electric 'trams' on wheels with steering that can go anywhere? Think they are called a busü§î Edinburgh have a couple through available grants

@PhilSpencerCFC @ShitChester @JohnWumz @CwacGreen Linking can still be achieved in an environmentally friendly way without alteration of existing infrastructure. There are so many little "Wins" that can be had in Chester IMHO.

@PhilSpencerCFC @ShitChester @JohnWumz @CwacGreen No. I agree that people should be able to arrive by train and get to the zoo & other facilities. Bikes won't achieve that & we saw the debacle that was just to do Chester drains, imagine how long a tramway would take in Chester!

@JohnWumz @ShitChester @CwacGreen would get my vote if they stop banging on about a tramway. There's a FAR simpler, cheaper, greener & quicker to implement option that can achieve the same if not more. We don't want to be LPool/MChester, but we want a tramway! Eh?
Its 2costly, 2slow to build. #debate
